medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute on chronic epigastric and right upper quadrant abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient reports that her pain began approximately ___ years ago when she was 5 months pregnant. The pain is located in the epigastric region, radiating to the RUQ, usually occurring at night a few hours after eating dinner. The frequency of the pain has increased over time and is often accompanied by nausea and vomiting. Currently, she presents with pain that began one day ago, worst in the epigastric region but radiating to the RUQ. She has vomited once since the pain began.
